intro: Leonohebe haastii, commonly known as the Haast's leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in New Zealand.
